name: Bali International Flight Academy (BIFA)
about: The Bali International Flight Academy (BIFA), established in 2009, is a premier aviation training institution located in northwest Bali, Indonesia. Founded by the late Robby Djohan, BIFA is committed to providing high-quality aviation education, endorsed by the Indonesian Director-General of Civil Aviation and the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). The academy offers a range of programs, including Private Pilot License, Commercial Pilot License with Instrument and Multi-Engine Ratings, and Airline Transport Pilot License. BIFA boasts modern facilities, including air-conditioned classrooms, three flight simulators, a well-stocked library, and a training fleet of 20 single and multi-engine aircraft. With over 800 graduates employed by major airlines such as Garuda, AirAsia, and Lion Air, BIFA is a leading choice for aspiring pilots, offering a comprehensive and well-structured curriculum to prepare students for successful careers in aviation.
